name: MATLAB-Fa14
tagline: CSE Training Workshops in MATLAB, Fall 2014 • MEL 1001, 10 am–Noon
body:
All workshops will be held in 1001 Mechanical Engineering Laboratory, an EWS computer laboratory. *If you are not an engineering student, you will need an EWS login to use the computer lab, so please email Neal Davis (contact information at bottom) at least 24 hours in advance.*

There is no sign-up for this series—walk-ins are welcome and encouraged!

# [Beginning Scientific Programming with MATLAB](#begin)
### Sep. 4, 10–Noon • MEL 1001

This workshop targets students with little to no programming experience.  We will conduct a hands-on walkthrough of what MATLAB has to offer as a foundation for later tutorials throughout the semester.

We will cover the following topics:

- Variables, functions, sequences, dictionaries
- Libraries and modules
- Loops, logic, and conditionals
- Input/output, files

(If you don't know what some of these mean, don't worry!  This is a gentle introduction.)

There is no sign-up for this series—walk-ins are welcome and encouraged!  *However, if you are not an engineering student, you will need an EWS login to use the computer lab, so please email Neal Davis (contact information at bottom) at least 24 hours in advance.*

# [Introduction to MATLAB](#intro)
### Sep. 11, 10–Noon • MEL 1001
### Sep. 25, 10–Noon • MEL 1001

This workshop, offered twice, targets students with some prior programming experience in other languages but who are interested in learning MATLAB for research or coursework.  We will conduct a hands-on walkthrough of what MATLAB has to offer as a foundation for later tutorials throughout the semester.

We will cover the following topics (in more depth than the beginning class above):

- Variables, functions, sequences, dictionaries
- Libraries and modules
- Loops, logic, and conditionals
- Input/output, files

# [Numerical Programming with MATLAB](#num-methods)
### Oct. 2, 10–Noon • MEL 1001
### Oct. 9, 10–Noon • MEL 1001

This tutorial focuses on the solution of basic differential equations and similar systems with MATLAB.

# [Distributed & Parallel MATLAB](#parallel)
### Oct. 16, 10–Noon • MEL 1001

# [MathWorks site visit:  MATLAB R2014b](#mathworks)
### Oct. 30 • Location TBD

# [Image Processing in MATLAB](#image)
### Nov. 20, 10–Noon • MEL 1001

# About These Workshops
### Contributors

# Contact
If you have any questions about course availability, concepts, or content, please contact Neal Davis, Training Coördinator for Computational Science & Engineering, at davis68 at illinois dot edu.
